intro: Corbassona intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate corbassona, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive, palmate leaves. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Corbassona intermedia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
